column4: good evening, any idea how to fix boot, if you have 2 main partitions, windows and ubuntu, to get windows partition to work again?
in which order did you install Windows and Ubuntu?
then do like Sandifordd said.  You should have an entry to boot into Windows when you boot.  Aren't you getting that?
In menu i got: ubuntu, memory test, and windows 7 (loader) (on dev/sda1)
I get back to the same grub
if you have enough time I would do it all over again.. instaling Windows first then Ubuntu.  Install grub ob the MBR not on a partition.
any chance to fix it somehow? I can see all disks from ubuntu
personally I don't have experience with Win 7 (yet).  But you could boot with Win 7 disk and let it fix the system for you.  But it will definitely mess up your MBR.
I suppose you could then use Ubuntu disk afterwards to reinstall Grub.
I think i installed grub on windows 7 boot partition :s
yes, I agree.  Win 7 boot disk should be able to fix that bit.
no way to edit boot somehow and get it to work?
your MBR is fine since you get grub to stage 1 but when you select the menu option for Win 7 it tries to pass on control for booting to Windows' loader which has been overwritten (I think)
and that's not something you can correct by any config file edit
first fixing Win 7 by a boot disk, and then fixing MBR by a Ubuntu disk is the only way I see short of reinstalling both Win 7 and Ubuntu.
you could try and get a second opinion from someone like Sandifordd...
